source.name: Question 11
source.instructions:
Assume port `6378` is bound to another process in the host machine, while port `6379` is free. What would happen if instead of running the original command, the user ran:
```bash
docker run -p 6378:6379 --network host redis
```

answers.answer: The container will fail since port `6378`, which is published on the host machine, is already in use.
The container will run since port `6379` is not bound to any process.
The container will fail since port `6379`, which is published on the host machine, is already in use.
The container will run since port 6378 is not bound to any process.
